program abc135_D

    implicit none

    integer*8, parameter :: MOD = 1000000007
    integer, parameter :: MAX_N = 200000  ! Adjust based on problem constraints

    character(len=200000) :: s
    integer :: n, i, pre, next, digit
    integer*8 :: base = 1
    integer, allocatable :: dp(:,:)
    
    ! Read the input
    read(*, '(A)') s
    n = len_trim(s)
    
    ! Allocate the DP array
    allocate( dp(0:n-1, 0:12) )
    dp = 0  ! Ensure all are zero initialized; maybe redundant since allocated as zero

    do i = 0, n-1
        integer :: ch
        character(len=1) :: current_char
        current_char = s(n - i : n - i)
        
        ! Determine current digit or ?
        if (current_char == '?') then
            ! Iterate over all possible digits (0-9)
            do next = 0, 9
                do pre = 0, 12
                    integer*8 :: prev_count
                    ! Calculate previous count
                    if (i == 0) then
                        prev_count = merge(1, 0, pre == 0)
                    else
                        prev_count = dp(i-1, pre)
                    end if
                    
                    integer :: new_mod = mod(base * next + pre, 13)
                    dp(i, new_mod) = mod(dp(i, new_mod) + prev_count, MOD)
                end do
            end do
        else
            ! Fixed digit
            digit = ichar(current_char) - ichar('0')
            do pre = 0, 12
                integer*8 :: prev_count
                if (i == 0) then
                    prev_count = merge(1, 0, pre == 0)
                else
                    prev_count = dp(i-1, pre)
                end if
                
                integer :: new_mod = mod(base * digit + pre, 13)
                dp(i, new_mod) = mod(dp(i, new_mod) + prev_count, MOD)
            end do
        end if
        
        ! Update base for next iteration
        base = mod(base * 10, 13)
    end do
    
    ! Output the result
    print *, dp(n-1, 5)
    deallocate(dp)
end program abc135_D
